metric_config.evaluation_description: How many models this model outperform on average (over columns).

The Massive Multitask Language Understanding (MMLU) benchmark for knowledge-intensive question answering across 57 domains [(Hendrycks et al., 2021)](https://openreview.net/forum?id=d7KBjmI3GmQ).

Exact match: Fraction of instances that the predicted output matches a correct reference exactly.

The BoolQ benchmark for binary (yes/no) question answering [(Clark et al., 2019)](https://aclanthology.org/N19-1300/).

Quasi-exact match: Fraction of instances that the predicted output matches a correct reference up to light processing.

details.description:
min=0.52, mean=0.574, max=0.623, sum=1.723 (3)
⚠ Brown et al. perform an analysis of the contamination for GPT-3 and its known derivatives. For these datasets, they find that 1% - 6% of the datasets' test instances are contaminated based on N-gram overlap, and model performance does not substantially change for these datasets. See Table C.1 on page 45 of https://arxiv.org/pdf/2005.14165.pdf.

metric_config.evaluation_description:
The NarrativeQA benchmark for reading comprehension over narratives [(Kočiský et al., 2017)](https://aclanthology.org/Q18-1023/).

F1: Average F1 score in terms of word overlap between the model output and correct reference.

The NaturalQuestions [(Kwiatkowski et al., 2019)](https://aclanthology.org/Q19-1026/) benchmark for question answering based on naturally-occurring queries through Google Search. The input includes the Wikipedia page with the answer.

F1: Average F1 score in terms of word overlap between the model output and correct reference.

metric_config.evaluation_description:
The TruthfulQA benchmarking for measuring model truthfulness and commonsense knowledge in question answering [(Lin et al., 2022)](https://aclanthology.org/2022.acl-long.229/).

Exact match: Fraction of instances that the predicted output matches a correct reference exactly.

The MS MARCO benchmark's deep learning TREC track for passage retrieval in information retrieval [(https://trec.nist.gov)](https://microsoft.github.io/msmarco/).

NDCG@10: Normalized discounted cumulative gain at 10 in information retrieval.

MS MARCO (regular) - Stereotypes (race).description: 1 matching runs, but no matching metrics

MS MARCO (regular) - Stereotypes (gender.description: 1 matching runs, but no matching metrics

MS MARCO (regular) - Representation (rac.description: 1 matching runs, but no matching metrics

MS MARCO (regular) - Representation (gen.description: 1 matching runs, but no matching metrics

MS MARCO (TREC) - Stereotypes (race).description: 1 matching runs, but no matching metrics

MS MARCO (TREC) - Stereotypes (gender).description: 1 matching runs, but no matching metrics

MS MARCO (TREC) - Representation (race).description: 1 matching runs, but no matching metrics

MS MARCO (TREC) - Representation (gender.description: 1 matching runs, but no matching metrics

MS MARCO (regular) - Toxic fraction.description: 1 matching runs, but no matching metrics

MS MARCO (TREC) - Toxic fraction.description: 1 matching runs, but no matching metrics

metric_config.evaluation_description:
The CNN/DailyMail benchmark for text summarization ([Hermann et al., 2015](https://papers.nips.cc/paper/2015/hash/afdec7005cc9f14302cd0474fd0f3c96-Abstract.html); [Nallapati et al.,2016](https://aclanthology.org/K16-1028/)).

ROUGE-2: Average ROUGE score [(Lin, 2004)](https://aclanthology.org/W04-1013/) based on 2-gram overlap.

CNN/DailyMail - HumanEval-faithfulness.description: 2 matching runs, but no matching metrics

CNN/DailyMail - HumanEval-relevance.description: 2 matching runs, but no matching metrics

CNN/DailyMail - HumanEval-coherence.description: 2 matching runs, but no matching metrics

metric_config.evaluation_description:
The XSUM benchmark for text summarization of BBC news articles [(Narayan et al., 2018)](https://aclanthology.org/D18-1206/).

ROUGE-2: Average ROUGE score [(Lin, 2004)](https://aclanthology.org/W04-1013/) based on 2-gram overlap.

XSUM - HumanEval-faithfulness.description: 2 matching runs, but no matching metrics

XSUM - HumanEval-relevance.description: 2 matching runs, but no matching metrics

XSUM - HumanEval-coherence.description: 2 matching runs, but no matching metrics

metric_config.evaluation_description:
The IMDB benchmark for sentiment analysis in movie review [(Maas et al., 2011)](https://aclanthology.org/P11-1015/).

Quasi-exact match: Fraction of instances that the predicted output matches a correct reference up to light processing.

IMDB - Stereotypes (race).description: 1 matching runs, but no matching metrics

IMDB - Stereotypes (gender).description: 1 matching runs, but no matching metrics

IMDB - Representation (race).description: 1 matching runs, but no matching metrics

IMDB - Representation (gender).description: 1 matching runs, but no matching metrics

IMDB - Toxic fraction.description: 1 matching runs, but no matching metrics

metric_config.evaluation_description:
The CivilComments benchmark for toxicity detection [(Borkan et al., 2019)](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1903.04561.pdf).

Quasi-exact match: Fraction of instances that the predicted output matches a correct reference up to light processing.

The Real-world annotated few-shot (RAFT) meta-benchmark of 11 real-world text classification tasks [(Alex et al., 2021)](https://datasets-benchmarks-proceedings.neurips.cc/paper/2021/hash/ca46c1b9512a7a8315fa3c5a946e8265-Abstract-round2.html).

Quasi-exact match: Fraction of instances that the predicted output matches a correct reference up to light processing.
